items.name: Component_ImageMap
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component_ImageMap # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_ImageMap extends gs.Component_Visual ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> @setupEventHandlers() @object.addObject(@ground) bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap("Graphics/Pictures/#{@object.images[0]}") ground = new gs.Bitmap(bitmap.width, bitmap.height) ground.blt(0, 0, bitmap, new Rect(0, 0, bitmap.width, bitmap.height)) @ground.bitmap = ground @setupHotspots(@hotspots) for h in @hotspots @object.addObject(h) ###* * A component which turns a game object into an interactive image-map. * * @module gs * @class Component_ImageMap * @extends gs.Component_Visual * @memberof gs ### constructor: -> super ###* * The ground/base image. * @property ground * @type gs.Object_Picture * @default null ### @ground = null ###* * An array of different hotspots. * @property hotspots * @type gs.Object_Picture[] * @default null ### @hotspots = null ###* * The variable context used if a hotspot needs to deal with local variables. * @property variableContext * @type Object * @default null ### @variableContext = null ###* * Indicates if the image-map is active. An in-active image-map doesn't respond * to any input-event. Hover effects are still working. * @property active * @type boolean * @default yes ### @active = yes ###* * Adds event-handler for mouse/touch events to update the component only if * a user-action happened. * * @method setupEventHandlers ### setupEventHandlers: -> gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseUp", @object) gs.GlobalEventManager.on "mouseUp", ((e) => contains = Rect.contains(@object.dstRect.x, @object.dstRect.y, @object.dstRect.width, @object.dstRect.height, Input.Mouse.x - @object.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - @object.origin.y) if contains and @active for hotspot in @hotspots if @checkHotspotAction(hotspot) e.breakChain = yes if hotspot.data.bindToSwitch hotspot.selected = !hotspot.selected @executeHotspotAction(hotspot) ), null, @object ###* * Initializes the image-map. Creates the background and hotspots. * * @method setup ### setup: -> @setupEventHandlers() @object.rIndex = 11000 # Receive Input Events first bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap("Graphics/Pictures/#{@object.images[0]}") bitmap.makeMutable() ground = new gs.Bitmap(bitmap.width, bitmap.height) ground.blt(0, 0, bitmap, new Rect(0, 0, bitmap.width, bitmap.height)) @ground = new gs.Object_Picture() @ground.bitmap = ground @ground.image = null @ground.zIndex = @object.zIndex @ground.imageHandling = gs.ImageHandling.CUSTOM_SIZE @object.addObject(@ground) @setupHotspots() @ground.srcRect.set(0, 0, ground.width, ground.height) @ground.dstRect.width = ground.width @ground.dstRect.height = ground.height @ground.update() @object.dstRect.width = @ground.dstRect.width @object.dstRect.height = @ground.dstRect.height ###* * Sets up the hotspots on the image-map. Each hotspot is a gs.Object_ImageMapHotspot * object. * * @method setupHotspots ### setupHotspots: (hotspots) -> @hotspots = @object.hotspots.select (v, i) => @ground.bitmap.clearRect(v.x, v.y, v.size.width, v.size.height) picture = new gs.Object_ImageMapHotspot() picture.fixedSize = true picture.srcRect = new Rect(v.x, v.y, v.size.width, v.size.height) picture.dstRect = new Rect(v.x, v.y, v.size.width, v.size.height) picture.imageHandling = gs.ImageHandling.CUSTOM_SIZE picture.zIndex = @object.zIndex + 1 picture.selected = hotspots?[i]?.selected ? no picture.enabled = hotspots?[i]?.enabled ? yes picture.actions = v.data.actions picture.data = v.data picture.commonEventId = v.commonEventId picture.anchor.set(0.5, 0.5) @object.addObject(picture) return picture ###* * Initializes the image-map. Frees ground image. * * @method dispose ### dispose: -> super gs.GlobalEventManager.offByOwner("mouseUp", @object) @ground.bitmap.dispose() ###* * Executes a hotspot's associated action. Depending on the configuration a hotspot * can trigger a common-event or turn on a switch for example. * * @method executeHotspotAction * @param {gs.Object_Picture} hotspot - The hotspot where the image should be updated. * @protected ### executeHotspotAction: (hotspot) -> GameManager.variableStore.setupTempVariables(@variableContext) if hotspot.data.bindToSwitch domain = GameManager.variableStore.domain GameManager.variableStore.setBooleanValueTo(hotspot.data.switch, hotspot.selected) if hotspot.data.bindValueTo domain = GameManager.variableStore.domain GameManager.variableStore.setNumberValueTo(hotspot.data.bindValueVariable, hotspot.data.bindValue) switch hotspot.data.action when 1 # Jump To @object.events?.emit("jumpTo", @object, { label: hotspot.data.label }) when 2 # Call Common Event @object.events?.emit("callCommonEvent", @object, { commonEventId: hotspot.data.commonEventId, finish: hotspot.data.finish }) when 3 # UI Action @object.events?.emit("action", @object, { actions: hotspot.data.actions }) if hotspot.data.finish @object.events?.emit("finish", @object) ###* * Checks if a hotspot's associated action needs to be executed. Depending on the configuration a hotspot * can trigger a common-event or turn on a switch for example. * * @method updateHotspotAction * @param {gs.Object_Picture} hotspot - The hotspot where the image should be updated. * @return {boolean} If true the hotspot's action needs to be executed. Otherwise false. * @protected ### checkHotspotAction: (hotspot) -> result = no hovered = hotspot.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - hotspot.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - hotspot.origin.y) if hovered and hotspot.enabled and Input.Mouse.buttons[Input.Mouse.LEFT] == 2 result = yes return result ###* * Updates a hotspot's image. Depending on the state the image of a hotspot can * change for example if the mouse hovers over a hotspot. * * @method updateHotspotImage * @param {gs.Object_Picture} hotspot - The hotspot where the image should be updated. * @param {boolean} hovered - Indicates if the hotspot is hovered by mouse/touch cursor. * @protected ### updateHotspotImage: (hotspot, hovered) -> baseImage = if hotspot.enabled then @object.images[2] || @object.images[0] else @object.images[0] if hovered and hotspot.enabled if hotspot.selected hotspot.image = @object.images[4] || @object.images[1] || baseImage else hotspot.image = @object.images[1] || baseImage else if hotspot.selected hotspot.image = @object.images[3] || baseImage else hotspot.image = baseImage ###* * Updates a hotspot. * * @method updateHotspot * @param {gs.Object_Picture} hotspot - The hotspot to update. * @protected ### updateHotspot: (hotspot) -> hotspot.visible = @object.visible hotspot.opacity = @object.opacity hotspot.tone.setFromObject(@object.tone) hotspot.color.setFromObject(@object.color) if hotspot.data.bindEnabledState GameManager.variableStore.setupTempVariables(@variableContext) hotspot.enabled = GameManager.variableStore.booleanValueOf(hotspot.data.enabledSwitch) if hotspot.data.bindToSwitch GameManager.variableStore.setupTempVariables(@variableContext) hotspot.selected = GameManager.variableStore.booleanValueOf(hotspot.data.switch) hovered = hotspot.dstRect.contains(Input.Mouse.x - hotspot.origin.x, Input.Mouse.y - hotspot.origin.y) @updateHotspotImage(hotspot, hovered) hotspot.update() ###* * Updates the ground-image. * * @method updateGround * @protected ### updateGround: -> @ground.visible = @object.visible @ground.opacity = @object.opacity @ground.anchor.x = 0.5 @ground.anchor.y = 0.5 @ground.tone.setFromObject(@object.tone) @ground.color.setFromObject(@object.color) @ground.update() ###* * Updates the image-map's ground and all hotspots. * * @method update ### update: -> super() @updateGround() for hotspot in @hotspots @updateHotspot(hotspot) return null gs.Component_ImageMap = Component_ImageMap
